data.event: In 2015, 161,785 people were residing on Guam.

event.title: settled the island approximately 4,000 years ago

data.event: The Chamorros, Guam's indigenous people, settled the island approximately 4,000 years ago.
Guam was colonized in 1668 with settlers, like Diego Luis de San Vitores, a Catholic missionary.
During the Spanishâ€“American War, the United States captured Guam on June 21, 1898.

event.title: ceded Guam to the United States on December 10, 1898

data.event: Under the Treaty of Paris, Spain ceded Guam to the United States on December 10, 1898.
